comments:
Eclipse 3.2.1

After exporting a headless app (a hello world) using the Export Product wizard, I could not get to run the application. The following error was logged in the config area log:

!SESSION Tue Jan 16 19:00:55 BRST 2007 -----------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 2007-01-16 19:00:55.390
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.io.IOException: Unable to initialize osgi.frameworkClassPath
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.addBaseJars(Main.java:571)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getDevPath(Main.java:470)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:650)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:274)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:977)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:952)

I found the following post on the newsgroups where someone fixed the problem by tweaking the generated install:

http://dev.eclipse.org/newslists/news.eclipse.platform.rcp/msg12466.html

Basically the org.eclipse.osgi bundle is generated by the wizard in its exploded form. As suggested by the author of that post, replacing the org.eclipse.osgi.<qualifier> dir with the jar from the Eclipse SDK install fixes the problem.

I have not been able to reproduce the problem, my exported rcp app was fine.

However, if I manually go to my exported app and unzip the osgi jar into a folder form, I then get the above error in my log.
So, if a problem exists, it is that the exported osgi jar is in folder form when it should be a jar.
I tried reproducing it with Eclipse 3.3 M6 and could not do it either.
